bug.short_desc: Development symlinks are missing and misplaced

long_desc.thetext:
/usr/bin/liblas-config --libs
-L/usr/lib -llas -llas_c -L/usr/lib64 /usr/lib64/libboost_program_options.so /usr/lib64/libboost_thread.so /usr/lib64/libgdal.so /usr/lib64/libgeotiff.so /usr/lib64/libtiff.so /usr/lib64/liblaszip.so
liblaszip.so doesn't exist at all. The other symlinks are placed in the libs sub-package, where they certainly don't belong.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 24 development cycle. Changing version to '24'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora24#Rawhide_Rebase
*** Bug 1313260 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I changed the spec file, so that liblas-config reports the libraries correctly:
-L/usr/lib64 -llas -llas_c -L/usr/lib64 -lboost_program_options -lboost_thread -lgdal -lgeotiff -ltiff -llaszip

Comment on attachment 1133110 liblas.spec bug fix
Refer to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1311953
liblas-1.8.0-12.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-a64ce1714e

liblas-1.8.0-12.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-a64ce1714e
